title: Fix TestTwoCloneCollision to compare content not timestamps
description:
The test at beads_twoclone_test.go:204-207 currently compares full JSON output including timestamps, causing false negative failures.

Current behavior:
- Both clones converge to identical semantic content
- Clone A: test-2="Issue from clone A", test-1="Issue from clone B"
- Clone B: test-1="Issue from clone B", test-2="Issue from clone A"
- Titles match IDs correctly, no data corruption
- Only timestamps differ (expected and acceptable)

Fix needed:
- Replace exact JSON comparison with content-aware comparison
- Normalize or ignore timestamp fields when asserting convergence
- Test should PASS after this fix

This blocks completion of bd-86.
acceptance_criteria:
- Test compares issue content (title, description, status, priority) not timestamps
- TestTwoCloneCollision passes
- Both clones shown to have identical semantic content
- Timestamps explicitly documented as acceptable difference
